metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7518 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel before version 4.12 in the way the KVMmodule processed the trap flag(TF) bit in EFLAGS during emulation of thesyscall instruction, which leads to a debug exception(#DB) being raised inthe guest stack. A user/process inside a guest could use this flaw topotentially escalate their privileges inside the guest. Linux guests arenot affected by this.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7518` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-119.143
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
